key_points: Lady Gaga wore a bulletproof dress when singing the national anthem at President Joe Biden's inauguration in January.
The outfit was a Schiaparelli Haute Couture design by creative director Daniel Roseberry.
The look included a structured navy fitted jacket and a red silk ballgown skirt.
Gaga highlighted a gold dove brooch with an olive branch in its beak as a symbol of peace.
She expressed pride in her Italian-American heritage through her choice of the Italian fashion house Schiaparelli.
Lady Gaga reminisced about Marine Capt. Evan Campbell, who escorted her to the microphone.
Gaga admitted to feeling nervous before her performance but found confidence in her fashion choice.
The specific details about how the dress was made bulletproof were not disclosed.
Gaga has previously described performing at the inauguration as 'the honor of my lifetime'.
She sent a prayer for unity and love to all the people living in the U.S. after her performance.
